title.justification: The title of the paper is provided at the beginning and is cited multiple times within the manuscript.
title.quote: Weakly Supervised Graph Contrastive Learning, WSN ET, a novel method that incorporates signals from weak labels for the contrastive learning objective.

extractions.description: The paper introduces Weakly Supervised Graph Contrastive Learning (WSNet), a novel method that integrates weak label signals into the contrastive learning objective for graph neural networks. The method is evaluated on benchmark graph datasets and demonstrates superior performance in high noise settings.

type.justification: The paper is largely focused on empirical evaluations and comparisons of the WSNet method against other baseline models using experiments on various datasets.
type.quote: We evaluate WSN ET on five benchmark graph datasets comparing its performance with state-of-the-art GCL and noisy-label learning methods.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on improving Graph Contrastive Learning (GCL) methods by incorporating weak supervisory signals.
name.quote: Graph Contrastive Learning (GCL) has recently gained popularity owing to its ability to learn efficient node representations in a self-supervised manner.

name.justification: The paper proposes a method, WSNet, that focuses on integrating weak labels (a form of weak supervision) into the graph contrastive learning framework.
name.quote: We introduce Weakly Supervised Graph Contrastive Learning, WSN ET, a novel method that incorporates signals from weak labels for the contrastive learning objective.

name.justification: The empirical evaluations in the paper are based on the node classification task on various datasets.
name.quote: we consider the task of weakly supervised node classification, where each node has multiple noisy labels.

name.justification: WSNet is the novel model proposed in the paper that leverages weak labels in graph contrastive learning.
name.quote: We introduce Weakly Supervised Graph Contrastive Learning, WSN ET, a novel method that incorporates signals from weak labels for the contrastive learning objective.

is_contributed.justification: WSNet is the new method proposed by the authors as a contribution in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Then, we introduce Weakly Supervised Graph Contrastive Learning, WSN ET, a novel method that incorporates signals from weak labels for the contrastive learning objective.

is_executed.justification: The paper mentions experimental evaluations and comparisons, indicating that the model was executed.
is_executed.quote: We evaluate WSN ET on five benchmark graph datasets comparing its performance with state-of-the-art GCL and noisy-label learning methods.

is_compared.justification: WSNet is compared against various baseline models in the experimental results section.
is_compared.quote: We experiment with several GCL methods on multiple graph datasets and combine graph communities and weak labels to introduce WSN ET, a new weakly supervised GCL method.

referenced_paper_title.justification: WSNet is introduced in this paper as a key contribution.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We introduce Weakly Supervised Graph Contrastive Learning, WSN ET, a novel method that incorporates signals from weak labels for the contrastive learning objective.

name.justification: Cora is one of the datasets used in the empirical evaluation of WSNet.
name.quote: We experiment with several GCL methods on multiple graph datasets and combine graph communities and weak labels to introduce WSN ET, a new weakly supervised GCL method.

name.justification: Citeseer is one of the datasets used in the empirical evaluation of WSNet.
name.quote: We experiment with several GCL methods on multiple graph datasets and combine graph communities and weak labels to introduce WSN ET, a new weakly supervised GCL method.

name.quote: We experiment with several GCL methods on multiple graph datasets and combine graph communities and weak labels to introduce WSN ET, a new weakly supervised GCL method.

name.quote: We experiment with several GCL methods on multiple graph datasets and combine graph communities and weak labels to introduce WSN ET, a new weakly supervised GCL method.
